javadoc: Interface that all subsection managers of a program must implement.

methods.name: setProgram
methods.comment:
Callback from program used to indicate all manager have been created.
 When this method is invoked, all managers have been instantiated but may not be fully initialized.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program is set when all the initializations have been completed.

methods.name: programReady
methods.comment:
Callback from program made to each manager after the program has completed initialization.
 This method may be used by managers to perform additional upgrading which may have been deferred.

params.name: openMode
params.comment: the mode that the program is being opened.

params.name: currentRevision
params.comment:
current program revision.  If openMode is UPGRADE, this value reflects 
 the pre-upgrade value.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the task monitor to use in any upgrade operations.

throws.comment: if a database io error occurs.
if the user cancelled the operation via the task monitor.

methods.name: invalidateCache

params.name: all
params.comment:
if false, some managers may not need to update their cache if they can
 tell that its not necessary.  If this flag is true, then all managers should clear
 their cache no matter what.

throws.comment: if a database io error occurs.

methods.name: deleteAddressRange
methods.comment:
Delete all objects which have been applied to the address range startAddr to endAddr
 and update the database accordingly.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the first address in the range.

params.name: endAddr
params.comment: the last address in the range.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the task monitor to use in any upgrade operations.

throws.comment: if the user cancelled the operation via the task monitor.

methods.name: moveAddressRange
methods.comment: Move all objects within an address range to a new location.

params.name: fromAddr
params.comment: the first address of the range to be moved.

params.name: toAddr
params.comment: the address where to the range is to be moved.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of addresses to move.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the task monitor to use in any upgrade operations.

throws.comment: if the length is such that a address wrap occurs
if the user cancelled the operation via the task monitor.

name: ManagerDB
comment: Interface that all subsection managers of a program must implement.
